title: Will Joe Biden run for president in 2020? - Quora

response.answer_text: I think Joe Biden will win the 2020 election, but it is still not guaranteed. There is only 16 days left until election day, and Biden has been able to maintain such a consistent lead over Trump. In 2016, Trump had the advantage of being the outsider and was trying to convince the voters that he was the lesser of two evils. There was a lot of hatred towards Hillary Clinton, and she had a high unfavorable rating. Now Joe Biden also has a more unfavorable rating, but not nearly as unfavorable as Clinton ever was. There are people out there that don’t like Joe Biden because of his policies, but there isn’t that hatred towards Biden like Clinton had. After the 2016 election, the exit polling showed that Trump won the lesser of two evils, and the last minute voters by big margins. Trump won’t have that advantage this time around. I believe Trump hurt his own chances over the last couple of weeks. When Trump tested positive for COVID-19, he missed a chance to gain some votes. After Trump was cleared by the doctors, and tested negative for the virus, he could have changed his view on the virus. He could have said something like please start to wear a mask and social distance because the virus is not good at all. But no, he said on Twitter that nobody should be afraid of the virus at all, and it is not a threat at all. Well he just pissed off a ton of people who had lost family members to the virus, or people who have had long term effects after having the virus themselves. He still doesn’t take the virus seriously. The elderly voters aren’t pleased by Trump’s response and he needs their vote to win the election. Another factor that could help Biden is that Democratic voters aren’t so apathetic this time around. Many Democratic voters chose to not vote, or vote third party in 2016 because the media was telling them that Trump had no chance of winning. And the polls were showing Clinton had the lead in key swing states. This time around, those apathetic voters aren’t so apathetic this time and are going to the polls in full force. Many Democrats don’t trust the polls even if it shows Biden with a lead. Trump has the advantage of high enthusiasm among his supporters compared to Biden, but there is also a huge anti-Trump vote. It’s going to be an interesting race. Trump still has about a 14 percent chance to win according to FiveThirtyEight election forecast. Those odds aren't good, but he still has a chance.

Probably, but...okay, let me open by saying I LIKE Joe Biden. As a neighbour or drinking buddy, he’d be fine – but as a PRESIDENT? NO. Of late, his touchy-feely ways with the ladies have drawn ire from the #metoo and #timesup movements. However, his unsuitability as POTUS stretches beyond that. First comes the fact that while Barry O was ALPHA – he is decidedly BETA. A perfect example is the Osama Bin Liner hit: Joe advised Barry to hold back until the intel improved, but despite the fact that Seal Team Six (there ARE no one-through-five) had made a DEBACLE of Operation Eagle Claw, costing Jimmy Carter his second term – Barry WENT for it and WON his second. Also, Veeps are famous for only being there to make POTUS look good. Think Pence, Quayle, Agnew – idiots all. But the main problem I have with Biden is his AGE. Right now, he’s seventy-six. If he won, he’d be seventy-EIGHT when he began his first term – and EIGHTY-SIX when/if he finished his second. Old geezers do NOT make good leaders. Think Mugabe, Reagan, Bolkiah – fine when they started, but SENILE by the end. And after four disastrous years of Trump, America will need someone with youth and vigour to rebuild her. Biden is NOT that person.

I don’t see an Electoral College landslide for either candidate. It will be won by 1 or 2 states. I think it is certain that Biden will have a landslide win in popular votes. Probably more than the 2.8 million Hillary got in 2016 but we don’t elect presidents by popular vote. At this point in time, Oct 22nd, I am leaning on a prediction that Biden will win but as I said, it is by no means certain. Trump won, in 2016, by an exceedingly narrow vote in three states. I don’t see any evidence that Trump has increased his popularity during this first term. He does have a solid base of support but I don’t see anything to indicate that he has gained more support.Biden is not Clinton. I don’t think anyone hates Biden. What conservatives seem to hate is the progressive wing of the Democratic party. The question is can hating a wing of the opposing party turn the election against the Democrats? Maybe . . .Both sides are pretty enthusiastic. The right strongly supporting Trump and voting against the progressive wing of the Democratic party. The left strongly voting against Trump and moderately supporting Biden. Moderate support might not sound like much but I am very impressed at the public restraint the progressive wing of the Democratic party has exhibited throughout this campaign. That restraint is a form of enthusiasm.Corona virus and the economy - There is no denying that the effects of the epidemic loom large in the present day largely against Trump. However you want to view the events of this year, it is happening on Trump’s watch. This being so unusual it is hard to say how the events of the response to the epidemic and the resulting economic downfall will play out. While Trump supporters like Trump’s handling of the economy pre-Covid that was a long time ago (politically speaking). This being a close election, what happened 10 months ago may not be as influential as the present.

Historian Allan Lichtman has written a book The Keys to The White House. The book gives a prediction system for the presidential election. Based on the premise that a pragmatic public uses the presidential election system as a rating of the incumbent president, the system has accurately predicted all but one election since 1984. Asking thirteen basic questions to gauge the election, if six or more questions are false then the challenging candidate is predicted to win the election. In 2016, Lichtman’s system predicted Donald Trump. This was obviously against many polls at the time. But guess who is the predicted 2020 candidate? It has switched to the Democratic candidate Joe Biden. Why have the predictors now waged against the incumbent? Lichtman analyzes that it is because of the numerous disasters of 2020, which has led to three more key questions turning false about the current state of the nation.  Licthman’s prediction, based upon this consistent and proven analytical system, is at the very least a profound testament to the unsettling times. No system is 100% foolproof(the Keys system has been criticized by some and did incorrectly predict the 2000 election), so it could end up that the election knocks holes into the theory. I really am not sure either way as to what exactly will happen. It is reassuring that there is a record turnout for early voters. Meanwhile, other polls show Biden has the lead in the national polls as well as states like Pennsylvania. However, all of the polls, plus Licthman’s system, seem to be indicators of who might be more likely to win and not who will probably win. One thing for sure is that if the incumbent does win his White House reelection bid then it will certainly be time for the experts and pollsters to revise their theories and systems.

Joe Biden will win handily, primary due to the ineptitude of Mr. Trump. Let us not forget that while running for office, 18 Trump associates had contacts with Russian operatives on at least 150 different occasions. Many of them lied about it and Trump went out of his way to obstruct any investigation into those contacts. When confronted with the choice between the US intelligence community and Putin, Trump chose Putin. Kim Jung Un manipulated Trump into stopping US naval exercises in the vicinity of North Korea, all the while not offering any concessions in return. He has so fractured America’s relationships with our allies that it may take a decade or more to recover. Several times over, world leaders have been filmed laughing at or making fun of Trump. Plenty of funny stories of them manipulating him at world conferences. Like the time the President of France tricked Trump into meeting with a representative of Iran. Then Trump got caught in an attempt to extort the president of the Ukraine. It was all part of a Russian hatched narrative. Something about it not being Russia that interfered into the 2016 election on behalf of Trump but instead it was the Ukrainians who interfered on behalf of Clinton. They even wove Hillary’s emails into it. Trump tried to get the President of the Ukraine to make public statements incriminating Joe Biden. For this, Mr. Trump was impeached. Although he was clearly guilty, Senate Republicans refused to do anything about it. Joe Biden is going to win in large part because he is a reasonable alternative to Trump. At some point the monied interests in America, the captains of commerce, industry and finance got together and decided Trump had to go. The harm he was doing to the country was just too great. Biden was chosen because they didn’t want Bernie Sanders, who is too radical for them. This election cycle all of the money and creative talent has sided with the Democrats. Those who would normally be creating attack ads against Democrats are now creating attack ads against Republicans. The Republicans are stuck using the B team. Not only will Biden handily win, the Democratic majority in the House will expand and the Senate will be taken away from the Republicans.

Biden looks in good shape but nothing is certain until the votes are counted however he and the democrats have things in their advantage that they did not have in 2016. People HATED Clinton, fair or not she was viewed as a snake who got away with way to much, she repelled independents and liberal Republicans who may have voted against trump but couldn't stomach voting for her Biden does not have that problemBernie, even though he lost more states than Hillary had significantly less primary votes than Clinton and basically lost to Clinton in the primaries but every metric refused to accept he lost to her and caused his followers to be bitter and either sit out, vote 3rd party or in some rare cases vote for Trump, this time Bernie accepted defeate in April and have been more active helping Biden than he was with Clinton allowing his followers to not be so bitter and more likely not to pull a protest voteWhen Comey reopened the e-mail investigation less than 2 weeks from the election Hillary dropped like a lead balloon, this latest “e-mail scandal” with Hunter Biden has so many holes in it even Fox won't touch it and the FBI is saying its disinformation from Russia outside of Trumps true believers this is. Big nothing burgerPeople remeber Clinton was well ahead and lost. Overconfidence from the democrats thinking Trump was certain to lose and either stayed home or voted 3rd party to “send a message" figured there would be no harm were shell shocked when Trump won, this time they are much more willing to “hold their nose and vote" as it is they have already been more early voted cast in Texas than there were people who voted for Trump in 2016..does that mean Trump will lose Texas…no of course not but statistically speaking higher turnout usually favors the Dems

It’s easy to say mean things about Hillary Clinton after her loss in 2016. But Hillary Clinton is a good reason why I do not believe Joe Biden will win the 2020 Presidential election. Let’s load up the way-back machine and remember why Hillary Clinton won the 2016 DNC nomination. Yes, a lot of people say the nomination was rigged, but if you pay close attention you’ll see that Hillary was organized and focused, with a clear message for voters. She started fast in her campaign and grabbed the lead. Sanders had his moments but was never the front-runner. But once the general election campaign started, things changed. Trump pounded Clinton at every opportunity, and seemed to be limitless in energy. Clinton began to show the strain of the long days and endless travel. She began to cancel appearances and twice appeared to collapse in public. The last week of the campaign, Clinton took most of two days off, at the same time that Trump was visiting over a dozen states. Pennsylvania and Wisconsin may both have been decided by that finish. Joe Biden is well-funded and has great name recognition, but he starts in a weaker position for 2020 than Clinton was for 2016. Add the fact the Democrats are the challenger party against an incumbent running for re-election, and Biden’s age becomes a danger factor. Biden is not built for a long campaign, and given the number of opponents he has to beat out to claim the DNC nomination, he will be spent long before the end of October.

Much of the essential job of being president is ceremonial and assembling a cohesive team that the POTUS trusts. Jimmy Carter(Who I volunteered for in 1976) was horrible at delegating. I doubt that Bernie or Biden would have that problem. I have interacted with Bernie’s staffers and been favorably impressed. The old obama/Biden folks should be well rested and available in 2020 and they know Joe well. I’m not a huge fan of Biden’s politics. I will be supporting Sanders if he runs. However, Biden is one of the more electable democrats(though Sander’s approval ratings are higher). I think there are two issues in Biden’s case: a) he needs a very detailed independent medical examination. That should be done in any case, but his age makes that more essential(as it would in sanders’ case also). b) He needs a running mate that is younger, highly competent and ready to be a more active VP. Cory Booker or Andrew Yang for President - Humanity First might fill that role if either can prove themselves on the campaign trail. This person needs to be a very strong campaigner, and someone that can clearly step in if Biden has health issues. If the polls and prediction markets hold up, I think Biden will run. However, I think part of the motivation may be to prevent big money from appointing a candidate less electable than Sanders. I think Biden wants to become POTUS. However, I think he wants to see Democrats win in 2020 more. I doubt Biden will pander to the more negative elements of the DNC. If Biden thinks he is less likely to win than Sanders, I think he may bow out. A Biden/Sanders contest will be one of electability and ideas. I think Biden believes in his ideas. I think he is wrong on a many points, but I do not doubt his sincerity. I also think it will be a clean contest, within the rules that now exist. I think if Biden does win the nomination, he might let Sanders have a big voice in choosing the VP/Cabinet, to unify the part.

Joe Biden will not win this election, its all hype like the 2016 election, the democrats advertised Hillary instead of Bernie Sanders, they pick candidate on how popular they are and conditioned people to vote for them instead of working to fix the issues, every one are so against Trump like he is the worse that ever happen to America, as a black person who is tired of the slave treatment by the democratic party i refuse to follow, every one are running a campaign on how bad he is but no one is willing to admit that he has done certain things right If the majority of the public cant be honest how can i stand with them, if Donald Trump is so bad how are we still running as a country, why is my business and investment been doing so well, you say he is a racist if you ask me all white people in America are racists, some are proud racists and the rest are silence racists who knows how to pretend, otherwise why are black people still marching for the same issues, white people make and change laws just like they have change the gun laws, how come the democrat law makers cannot change or pass any laws in favor of black people, how come the white community have not call on the government for prison and police reform like they do for immigration and gun laws? They say Trump devides the country, well unless youre living in denial America has been divided way before him, which is why a young kid like Trayvon Martin can get murdered by a racist person because he looks like he did not belong to that neihgborhood, as a black person i would rather die instead of voting for Joe Biden, it would be me signing up my kids for slavery, the black community dont see it like i see it thats why we are still living like slaves, shot down like dogs by white cops and those politicians stood there and watch as we march and beg for equality, may Biden rest in peace he is an old white racist person who sees things the same way from the world he came from

Will Joe Biden run for president in 2020? He certainly will try, but not because he loves America. He will try out of mere desperation, because he has to save face - but he, among other House DP’s will first be prosecuted - Alana Logan's answer to Do you think that former VP Joe Biden is guilty of pressuring Ukraine to pull a prosecutor off a corruption case that involved his son, Hunter? Biden will never become President of the United States, and the following is just one more reason why not - His blatant dishonesty … Alana Logan's answer to Did Joe Biden exert undue influence over Ukraine to benefit his son? Alana Logan's answer to Would Joe Biden make a good President?

No, I don’t think he will. He’s up in all the national polls by a large margin. I also think national polling is virtually irrelevant. The popular national vote is not a factor in electing a president. In the “swing states” the polling is quite close. Trump has voter enthusiasm to a level not seen in a Republican incumbent since Reagan. While his white, non college demo is lower than it was in ‘16, his Hispanic and African American support is greater than any Republican in a generation. His support among white gay males is near 45%. I think if you add those up along with the lack of enthusiasm for Joe Biden and the fact that a good majority of Dems are afraid to stand in line to vote, add up to a Trump victory. I should qualify that I don’t think he’ll win the Hispanic or AA vote, but I think he’ll take a larger percentage than any Republican in a generation. That will hurt the Dems.

No. I have no idea if he will run for President. But I’m responding to the original question of if he should run for President. The Presidency is not for people in their 60’s and 70’s. Elizabeth Warren, Hillary Clinton, Joe Biden, Bernie Sanders, Donald Trump—regardless of what you think of each of them personally, I feel each one of them is too old for the position. It’s too easy for someone in their 60’s to quickly go downhill from dementia or some other aging issue. And our current President shows how poorly we are set up to confront issues around the temperament and mental capability of the President. Additionally, all you need to do is to look at how the position aged George W. Bush and Barack Obama (both young men, both VERY physically fit, strong marriages, good kids, great support systems). You truly need someone who’s willing to put in 16 hour days 7 days a week and has the physical and mental strength to still portray a positive and “can do” outlook to the nation. Right now we’ve got a President who usually is “in the office” from 10am-4pm, and spends 1/3rd of his first two years at Trump properties (where yeah, some work gets done but let’s be honest—he’s eating and playing golf and watching TV…he’s not reading briefing papers or chairing 3 hour discussions about urban planning or mass transit or infrastructure policy).

I think it is very unlikely Joe Biden will run for president. In 2020, Joe Biden will be 78 years old. President Trump actually won as the oldest president at age 70. I think Joe Biden would do whatever is best for his party, however ultimately I think he will see the reason why he shouldn’t run and (quietly) say no, right up until the Democratic party forces him to say so. Give poor Joe a break, will you? The Democratic Party has a rough road ahead. If the Republican Party does not go against its incumbent, the Demos will have to dislodge Trump (or Pence if something happens…) . As easy as that might sound, it isn’t. Demos tend to fall into a trap where they think they’ve picked a quality candidate based on conformity to some sub-group and, that candidate either carried too much baggage (like Hillary) or lacked anything resembling leadership qualities. Quite a few possible candidates are in the process of ‘polishing themselves’ but nobody really stands out so far.

No. Biden will lose. Trump will win in an electoral landslide based on the substance of his accomplishments (which his supporters like) not the style of his way of dealing with the constant vilification the left media throws at him. Think of the vote this way: Do you support: Deregulation and economic growth? Tax Reform and repatriation of jobs to America? Border control and high employment of American underclass and working class citizens? Trade Treaty renegotiation ending things like China, Japan and S Korea charging the US 25% tariffs and the US charging them a tenth of that at 2.5% tariffs? Ending the endless wars? Energy independence and much lower energy costs? Negotiating peace treaties Between Israel and the UAE & Bahrain or Kosovo and Serbs that the establishment could not do in the last 30 years? Rebuilding our military and bringing our troops home so that we can strengthen to deter the real threat to our liberty long term - the new AXIS powers of China, Russia and Iran allied to control Eurasia? If your answer is YES - Vote for Trump If your answer is NO - vote for Biden But vote on substance not style or media manipulation (especially when you realize the media is owned by the multinationals and billionaires who support the Democrat and RINO party and do not have your interests at heart.

Normally I would say no given his age and that he chose not to run last time , however I think watching Trump is something that forces Biden to at least put his hat in the ring in case the democratic party tries to go with another candidate like Clinton. The real thing is which wing of the party is strongest in the primary, usually you have 2 or 3 serious candidates but they do not all come from the same political ilk: Expect Bernie Sanders or Elizabeth Warren or Jerry Brown to come from the populist side. Both are on the liberal end of the Democratic section. I could see Sanders stepping aside for the younger more energetic Warren if she wants to push the progressive movement harder. Joe Biden would be more centrist for the party and Jerry Brown is talking about moving California’s primary up in the order and that could get interesting. He’s not really a populist but on the left side in terms of social issues. Corey Booker also is on the center line here policy wise and its really a question of when not if he’s going to declare. Tammy Duckworth if she wants to run could be extremely political if the democratic base is energized enough to get conservative democrats to the primaries. She’s one a dark red house district before, she could get race baited by some into believing shes foreign but as a disabled vet she’d be hard to take on directly. Chris Murphy could also come from this direction. It’s hard to see the democratic coalition fielding more than 3 viable candidates after the first 5 or 6 primaries though. So If Biden wants to go that direction he’s got to worry more about Jerry Brown and Corey Booker than Trump at first.

Seriously? It’s been in all the papers—-not to mention all over television, the Internet and elsewhere. Yes, former Vice President Biden is making a run for President, just as he did unsuccessfully two times previously (1988 and 2008). In his defense, it is often said that he “withdrew” in 1988, but he did lost to Obama in 2008—-and ended up on the ticket as Vice President, which he was from 2008 through 2016. Prior to that, going all the way back to 1972, Joe Biden served in the Senate. He ran numerous times and, aside from the 2 presidential races mentioned in this paragraph, has won every time. His chief rival, Bernie Sanders, also began serving in various capacities in 1972. However, in his runs for office he lost six (6) times, two times when involved in a run to become Governor of the state of Vermont.

Here's one thing about Biden… his time is done. That is not me saying this, it was a CNN focus group of Clinton voters. CNN focus group rejects Biden If Biden joins the race he will come out ahead and get the media behind him… then he will open his mouth with some of the comments that those who watch out have seen, things like telling Millennials to give him a break and that the rich are patriotic. Just poor taste comments that will turn off voters. I imagine he would split the vote away from the other establishment favorites like Harris and Booker, he would shine brightly early then like a falling star fade away before the first primary. So do I think he will enter the race… probably, he has some serious backers. But in the end I don't think he will last and will just serve to break up the establishment donor base which will serve someone like Sanders very well. I'd also add that Biden's tough on crime stance regarding the 1994 Crime Bill had him proudly saying on the Senate floor that the papers were saying Biden wanted the death penalty for everything except jaywalking so good luck in Florida where 1.5 million ex-felons just got their voting rights restored.

Q: Do you think Joe Biden will win the 2020 election and why do you think so? A: If Biden manages to win the Democratic primary to become the party’s nominee, then yes, I think he’ll win in the general election. But my guess is that Biden will not win the nomination. I think there are better candidates, but currently they are buried in a pack of way too many contenders for the voters to have made much sense of it yet. I’m guessing that after a few debates, a bunch of candidates that have still failed to gain any traction will exit the race, and we’ll finally have a chance to really focus on a few serious contenders. And then I think there’s a good chance that at that point someone else - Harris, perhaps, or Warren, or Booker - someone - will start to look like a much better choice to Democratic primary voters than good ol’ Uncle Joe. But if indeed Biden emerges as the nominee, all signs seem to point to him having the edge over Trump in the general election. Current polling certainly suggests that outcome. But in addition, I don’t see in Trump any ability, or even inclination, to expand his support beyond his current fervently loyal but not-big-enough base. Also, I don’t think the next 17 months are going to go well for Trump. Court decisions will be gradually removing his ability to hide documents or block testimony from Congressional investigations. Before the election, I expect a lot of embarrassing revelations to become public knowledge. And there’s also the investigations from the Southern District of New York into matters like Trump’s bogus charity, his company’s fraudulent under-reporting of income and assets for tax purposes and over-reporting of same for securing loans, and various misdeeds of his campaign and his inauguration teams. I won’t be a bit surprised to see a downturn in the economy come about before the election to further nail the coffin closed on Trump’s reelection aspirations. Of course, it’s still very early. Anything could happen. Trump could win. But I suspect he will lose - and I think he may even lose in a landslide.

Joe Biden will not win. His corruption together with his son, brothers, and sister in law will be gradually exposed the closer it get to the election. Mainstream media hides this truth from the people because most of their families worked under the Obama administration and the Democratic party but those who are open minded and resourceful enough to expand their sources know that Joe Biden is corrupt. The corruption is not a petty $83,000/month salary for Hunter but millions of dollars in service fees and commissions on billion dollar investments. Think that what was exchange in return is our tax money and national security. This could be the crime of the century and people just disregard it. What Hunter Biden wrote a letter to his daughter, Naomi: “But I don’t receive any respect and that’s fine I guess. Works for you, apparently. I hope you all can do what I did and pay for everything for this entire family for 30 years. It’s really hard, but don’t worry, unlike Pop (Joe Biden) I won’t make you give me half your salary.”

After seeing an inrerview on CNN with Biden I actually think is seriously considering running in 2020. I don't think his age is a serious factor, he's in good health. Joe Biden loves America, and I think the determining factor will be the damage he thinks Trunp has done to our country and if he thinks any of the other Democratic candidate's are electable. If Hillary ( very doubtful), or Bernie Sanders run, and are the front runner,,Biden will run. Neither is electable, especially Hillary. Now,,if a new young face joins the race on the Democratic side, and they are doing very well in the polls. Joe will not run. So, I don't think age will factor his decision. The political climate, and who the Democratic nominee is will influence Joe Biden's decision more than anything else. If Joe decides to run, I really hope he picks a woman VP candidate. Maybe, Senator Tammy Duckworth.

Will Joe Biden run for president in 2020? He doesn’t WANT to run, but I believe he will because we NEED him to run. Being an old-school politician, he’ll do what’s needed for the country. And we need a decent, reasonable, professional politician in the White House for 8 years, to undo the damage the current occupant is doing to the country. We can’t risk anyone lesser being in the White House because it may take decades to undo Trump’s damage. Joe Biden is popular with Congressional leaders on both sides. He knows how to compromise, how to make deals, and how to get things done. Much as I regret the need to interrupt Mr Biden’s much-deserved retirement, I hope he runs to save the country and ACTUALLY make America great again.

He certainly seems likely to, and honestly, I hope he does. He’d be just what the United States needs right now: experienced, calm, reasonable leadership. There is the question of his age to consider, but he’s got all his marbles, and he’d still make a better President than Donald Trump (by a considerable margin). I think his best bet would be to run at the top of the ticket, but bring on a younger energetic candidate for VP at the bottom of the ticket: Kamala Harris, Cory Booker, Tulsi Gabbard. Someone who could learn the ropes from Biden, possibly step into his shoes if the worst happens, and if not, someone who could follow up a Biden Presidency with their own Presidential bid in 2024–28. And you have to be honest: you want to see a return of the Biden Meme scene.  In all seriousness, though: he’s got the charisma, the experience, the support, the gravitas, and the ability to serve as an effective President. Remember: Obama picked this guy as the man to pick up the Presidency if anything happened to him, and served faithfully and well in that office for eight years. He’s a loyal Democrat, he worked superbly with Obama, and he’s a guy that will put the country first. Screw it: #Biden2020. Make it happen, people.

Absolutely not. The election is totally rigged. Just like Trump lost the last election he is doing everything in his power to throw doubt onto the whole process because he knows he will have far less votes this time after the most disgraceful presidency in history. The RHINOS have packed the courts and are trying to put the last nail in the coffin after their hypocritical nomination of supreme court justice during an election. Lincoln is turning in grave with how far his party had fallen. Violent Crime at a 30 year high. Citizens being murdered by the police in their beds. The world closer to a world war. Hundreds of thousands of citizens dead from a lack of coordinated response. The largest stock market bubble in history coupled with the worst economy since the great depression. Government printing presses subsidizing every industry from farms to wall street like the communists do. A disgrace a total disgrace.

Joe Biden’s time is past. He lacks the vigor and wisdom for a fight against Trump who is prepared to ruin him. Much of the electorate is depraved enough to vote for Trump one more time. As long as he gets 40% or so of the vote, he can claim that the election was rigged against him and hold onto power through the courts. Al Gore won Florida, but the Supreme Court (which lacked jurisdiction under the constitution) stopped the Florida Supreme Court’s mandated recount to give the election to Bush Junior. The consequences were a disaster for America, but billionaires did quite well, thank you. It’s not like the election of an unpopular president has never before been supported by the highest court in the land. The Supreme Court will make sure any appeals by Trump are heard and ruled on in his favor. The coming 2020 election is pointless. Americans lost their way of governance in 2016; they won’t get it back for a long time to come. It’s the way it is. Get used to it. 2020 Election Boycott

If he was a bit younger, yep. Otherwise, nope. He’s at the high-risk-for-old-brain age. However, if he is nominated and running against Trump, I’m hands-down Biden. Hell, I’d vote for a mob boss before another term of Trump. I’d vote for a Trump supporter, because a Trump supporter would actually for Trump’s good promises (believed lies) too and not just the crappy ones. Decent Trump supporters voted for him DESPITE his stupid promises, which are the only ones Donny Dim is really pushing.

He would legally be allowed to, but Joe Biden is 73 which would have made him the oldest person to take the office of president if he had run and won this year. He will be 77 in 2020. It seems incredibly unlikely that he would run based just on his age. Additionally, he has campaigned twice for the nomination in the past and never gotten it. The same is true for Sanders and Clinton, who are 75 and 69 respectively and would have beaten or tied the previous record of 69. Their political prospects decrease as they age, leaving aside the overall perception of them as “losers.” Incidentally, that Record for Oldest President was previously held by Ronald Reagan. It was in fact beaten by Donald Trump, who is 70. Yes, no matter who won they would have beaten or tied the record for oldest president ever.

Biden stands to win in November, because the disapproval poll on Trump is larger than any winning candidate can ever have. This poll is very stable and unlikely to change. The largest factor in the poll must be lack of confidence in mitigation of Covid19, and the never ending death toll nearing 200,000. The Federal Deficit is larger than ever. The Economy is in particular trouble with the commercial real estate market value going down in many large cities in many areas of America. What direction is the Country going in ,do you think?

He has confessed while cameras are rolling, he will run (essentially, if the Democrats offer their F rated candidates i.e. Hillary etc, but he will not if there is some one credible). Who? The only obvious is Sanders. Biden also said, he will not challenge Pence due to Huuuuuge age difference, but 3 years between him and Trump is nothing. One can argue Biden is more fit than Trump just by looking their weights.

response.answer_text: He doesn’t have a chance! And worse still. The Democrats don’t have a single candidate that doesn’t want to raise our taxes to pay for. Free healthcare for all including illegal aliens. Free College for all including illegal aliens. Reparation for African Americans, or spend US $16 trillion on climate change. The made up catastrophe used by socialists to instill fear and guilt to tax, regulate, and remove our freedoms while pretending to be saving our planet. They all want to remove our second amendment, yet defend sanctuary cities that suffer same of the worst gun violence in the country. And the all have a Socialist/ Communist agenda. No Biden doesn’t have a chance

It is likely that Joe Biden will join the burgeoning group of potential Democratic candidates. Although he appears hesitant at least for the moment, Biden has the “fire in his belly” and has dreams of becoming President of the United States. He has the money, the experience, and the name recognition. If he were not a viable candidate, I don’t think anyone would be mentioning him. Biden’s biggest problem is that he tends to speak before he thinks and, quite frankly, he has not mastered the art of productive and effective speech-making. The 2020 nomination is most likely his last chance, and since the bar has been unbelievably lowered, a gaffe here and there doesn’t appear to have much effect. If Trump could survive the sex tape during his campaign, I can’t imagine anything “Joe” could say that would sidetrack him. Besides, he’s enormously likeable. Joe Biden? Why would he not join the campaign?

If he gets the Democratic nomination and has a suitable Vice Presidential candidate, yes. Biden represents the broad middle of the Democratic Party. He will get organized labor and the suburban voters. His Vice President will have to be from the progressive wing of the party. Biden needs to run to the left and then govern in the middle. Bernie Sanders, Elizabeth Warren, or Kamala Harris all fit the bill. Together they will create the team the whole Democratic Party and Independent Voters will support to win.

No, his time has passed. He should have tried to run in 2016. I firmly believe he would have beaten Hillary for the nomination and won in a landslide over Trump. In 2020, he will be 78. Sorry, Joe, too late. Democrats need to run a younger person, maybe a woman and I am not referring to Hillary or Elizabeth Warren.

This is my opinion. I believe the population of the United States will rise to the occasion and Joe Biden and crazy woman Harris would not be the ticket that wins. First and foremost I think Joe Biden's dementia makes him a bad candidate. Couple that with it being a with his being a pedophile I believe the United States let that come into the office. Then finally having Harris on the ticket is the final final straw that'll sink that ship she's a crazy woman crazy ideas too far left. Again this is my opinion

Joe Biden is set to pull off the greatest political victory since Reagan won 49 states in 1984. Having worked on Capitol Hill for 20 years and seeing this man in action, I have no doubt that the polls are true and that he is running a phenomenal ground game. Biden has never lost a battle and we used to say that he “goes from conquest to conquest leaving only fire in his wake.” The figures suggest he will win all states except Oklahoma. Even Utah is in play!

Probably. Even without formally entering the race, he polls in the lead. The inappropriate touching and past policy issues were already known issues, and do not appear to have impaired Biden’s popularity with his constituency in the Democratic Party, which skews older and more centrist than the high visibility Millennial- and Gen X-led party activists and candidates. Whether or not he wins the nomination, it seems fairly certain that he’s going to run.

No. He’s been holding back to judge what the fallout will be from his groping. He has the charisma of Mike Pence and is disgusting. Biden’s videos with his creepy hands all over little girls and whispering into their ears and kissing their hair when he is NOT their grandfather is what secret pedophiles do for thrills! Look at similar behaviors by the Catholic priests!! It is the SAME thing! This is not a political problem; it is a question of one man’s perversions. You can even see one of the little girls squirming to get away from him and his wandering hands!!

Joe Biden said he will not rule it out absolutely but that he has no intention of running in 2020. I imagine his decision will be based on the pool of candidates and the political landscape in 2018. Unless there are no viable and electable Democratic candidates, I don’t think he will run. He has publicly stated that he regrets not having run in 2016, though, so… you never know. The heart wants what it wants.

Hello, Mohammed Saiful Alam Siddiquee. My name is Murk; I am an expert. I’m here to help you. To determine whether or not Joe Biden is running for the 2020 election, we must first understand the concept of running for an election. Let’s discuss that now. Okay, now that that’s taken care of, we can now determine whether or not Joe Biden is running for the 2020 election. You’re welcome. I’m an expert. You’re not. Murk Shoeman is an expert.

My gut answer is No. Joe has to many other things to do and I believe his tenure in government has pretty much taken the steam out of him. 2020 is along way away. Besides, President Trump and the Republican’s in Congress may just pull their agenda off and have the country humming like a Cummings diesel or it could be a complete disaster that Joe wouldn’t wan to touch. It’s time for the younger generation to get in and do their job.

It remains to be seen. He has stuck his head up a few times, but it would be hard to say that he is “in” the campaign even though he is technically in the election. The DNC seems to be believing their own skewed polls again and are certain they have already won so they don't want to risk Joe being out in public and getting into arguments with voters.

Legally there is no reason why not. The prospect of a Biden run in 2020 has been talked about but I do not think it will happen. He has ran before in the primaries and not gone very farHe will be in his late 70s by 2020I can’t help feeling 2016 was his best chance to run following on from Obama

I think he’ll try, and I think he’s capable of handling himself if Trump tries to call him “Crazy Joe” or another belittling nickname. I just wish he were 20 years younger. He’s already survived two brain aneurysms and I worry about the rigors of a campaign.

I don’t think there’s any doubt that if the Vice President is in good health, he will compete in the competition among Democrats in 2020. And, he is popular and a good political candidate. My guess is that about a dozen people will be vying for the nomination. And, my prediction is that Hillary will get it again.

Biden is in his mid 70s. I think that if there is some red-hot candidate who seems capable of winning and doing a good job he probably won’t run. If the situation is more fluid or it seems like there is no candidate that can win, he will probably run. He most likely would have won had he run last time, and I would say he would have a great chance of winning if he could get the nomination next time. But again, he’s getting up in years and I don’t know if that’s the best situation.

I think he should if he can reconcile that with his conscience and his family. With very few missteps, he’s been a stellar servant to the people; he has about 1//20th of a skeleton in the closet. But more importantly, he’s a honest, ethical person who got into politics to do good. He’s a relatable man who has had many tragedies in his own life. He isn’t arrogant, dishonest or scummy. I’d love it.

Why? He’s been wrong on just about everything in his career. Remember for example with Iraq he wanted to divide the country into three separate countries and force one to share oil revenue with the others…and at the same time said Bush’s “surge” wasn’t going to work. And what has he accomplished? After Sandy Hook, Obama put Biden in charge of gun control. What came of that? Nothing. Old Uncle Joe isn’t good for anything but an occasional laugh.

More than likely, however, I think that there are other democrats who are better at arguing. Biden could not stand up to Harris when they were having an argument. I would hate for him to have to debate Trump, as I think that he would make hamburger meaat out of him and have it for lunch.

No. I love Uncle Joe but he doesn’t have the fire in his belly necessary to take on the climb to the Presidency. He’d make a decent President, I think, but he’s just not focused enough in his communication to carry the day in a campaign. But if he won the nomination, I’d be glad to vote for him.

The verdict is obviously still out. I would hazard a guess that he is in the driver’s seat, but he is taking a corner too tight and there is no door or seat belt. The debate will be the deciding factor as this will tell the electorate if the man has the mental acuity to do the job. Of note, the numbers are eerily similar to 2016 but with Biden a slightly bigger edge. And slightly would have made the difference for Secretary Clinton.

The Bush’s, Biden's, Clinton’s, etc. would be doing the nation a great service if they would put their own egos aside and mentor new leadership to develop responsible political leaders. Recycling older ones is short-sighted and does not help the parties grow and move forward. We are paying the price for poor leadership now with gridlock in the legislative branch, turmoil in the executive branch and corruption permeating both branches. Recycling is great, just not in politicians…
Today, yes. But he'll drop - even the Dems don't like Joe. He is not extreme enough. Also he is not electable. He has a record, political record. Oh, and he's bats.

At this point(?) It will be a toss up in the battleground states. However, given the seething discontent surrounding Trump, and another inevitable screw up on HIS part (because he can’t help himself); it’s Biden year….

I highly doubt it. He’d be 78 by then and I still don’t know if he really wants to be President given that he might have been able to win this time and didn’t even try. He’ll probably stick around to comment on whoever the potential nominees are though

No, I have more faith in the American people that that. Surely the nation is not insane enough to believe a senile old man such as he could possibly run a nation. He is one month younger than I am. Believe me he needs to sit down and keep his ultra liberal views to himself.

No, I don’t believe Biden will run. He isn’t young anymore and has a lot of public service in his life. He has put in his time. If he wanted to, 2016 was his best chance. My guess is that he would have been the nominee and likely won the election.

According to long time policy aides, Biden is currently considering running for president in 2020. Given that Biden has long desired to be president — he reportedly regretted not running in 2016 — and if no clear Democratic star emerges, I would say that the chances of him running in 2020 are better than 50–50. He is still popular within his party, but age may be his biggest drawback: on Inauguration Day, 2020. he’ll be 78-years-old.

Yes, if he wants to, just as any one else who meets the Constitutional requirements can run for president If the old fool could be elected is an entirely different question, but it would be interesting to see him try.

No. I think most American will forget about being a Democrat or a Republican and smell the air, remind themselves how much better off they are today than they were four years ago and vote accordingly.

As a matter of fact, Yes, he is running for primaries against some tough opponents, notably, Elizebeth Warren of Massachusetts and Bernie Sanders. they both are more active and people are showing support to both, on the other hand, Joe Biden has more experience than these two. Let’s see Who make it to final.

No. That window has closed and Dems probably don't want to revert to a candidate who was part of a prior administration that demonstrated no ability to inject enthusiasm in their base during the 2016 election.
I am a Native Delawarian and voted many times for Mr. Biden…but if he follows President Obama,s footsteps I will not vote for him…

He’s done a few things that seem to indicate that he’s thinking about it. I hope he doesn’t. I like Biden a lot, but he’s too old. His time has passed. But will he? At this point, I’d say “flip a coin”.

Yes. Why? Because I am a moderate (technically extreme one way or the other one some topics, but moderate overall). I know moderates. We do not control the news, and most of us are pretty quiet about our political views. I am voting for Biden. So are the other moderates I know. We previously left that spot blank or voted for Trump. People on the left and the right act like they understand swing voters. They do not.
Yes. As far as polls go, he is also currently ahead of the other Democrats who are running. RealClearPolitics - Election 2020 - 2020 Democratic Presidential Nomination
Joe Biden has every right to seek the Presidency it is likely he will do so, and would easily defeat the current incumbent.

It's hard to say for sure. He has expressed interest in running, but hasn't given a definitive answer. He will likely end up not running though because of his age. He will be 77 on Election Day and 78 on Inauguration Day.

Joe Biden and Kamala Harris make a good pair . Fifty million people have already voted . The performance of Tump in the final face off was a toned down version of his earlier speeches . All the same it did not indicate any major change of heart among the voters .

I’d like to see what the rest of the field looks like but age notwithstanding, I think he’d make an excellent candidate and a great president.
Joe Biden cannot win the presidency. He should not run for president. He may get die hard democrats voting for him but he will not get the swing voted needed to win the election if he is the nominee.

Bad idea for Democrats with so many other better candidates to put on the ballot. Good idea for the Republicans since the last election shows the country wanted a change from the Obama / Biden administration.
